definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: And one-armed bandit is the commodity that national explicit order prohibits selling.
sentences.chinese: 而赌博机是国家明令禁止销售的商品。

sentences.english: So that's often a big restriction that a lot of dorms will put. But here, here at law school,
sentences.chinese: 这是许多宿舍明令禁止的。但是在法学院，

sentences.english: Thirty states have banned texting while driving.
sentences.chinese: 至今30个州已明令禁止了边驾驶边发短信的行为。

sentences.english: The DMCA explicitly prohibits the dissemination of information that can be used to circumvent such technology.
sentences.chinese: DMCA明令禁止传播用于规避该技术的内容。

sentences.english: Dewclaws must be removed except in countries where this practice is forbidden by law.
sentences.chinese: 狼爪要去除，除非是为所在国之法律所明令禁止。

definition: to totally prohibit/to put an end to
to state in writing (laws, rules etc)
to repeal (a law)/to put an end to/abolition/annulled
